title: stadus
author: stadus
content: QuoteAccording to the latest report from New York Digital Investment Group (NYDIG), Bitcoin continues to stand out as the best-performing asset in 2024. Additionally, Q4 is expected to remain positive for Bitcoin’s price, despite facing various challenges.https://beincrypto.com/bitcoin-best-performing-asset-2024/With that information we see above, it shows that Bitcoin has had a very positive year, and the year isn’t even over yet. If it hits a new ATH by the end of the year, that percentage of profit will increase significantly. We should definitely believe in investing in Bitcoin since it's backed by data.If there are people we want to convince to invest but who are still doubtful, we can point them to this thread. They can ask questions, and we’re ready to share facts with them.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: I believe everyone knows this because it is so obvious but the problem is that not all investors consider profit as their top priority. Bitcoin is the most profitable investment but its volatility and risk are also the greatest. The higher the profit, the greater the risk and vice versa. Meanwhile, investors' tastes are different, some like safety, real assets, stability...so it all depends on each investor's choice. We don't need to force anyone to invest in bitcoin just because it gives the best returns or criticize someone for ignoring it when returns are not their top priority. Currently, I have invested most of my assets in crypto but when I reach my goal and have the desired amount I will only invest a small portion in bitcoin and will diversify into many other assets. While bitcoin has long term potential, once I have enough money I won't want to risk too much and will instead prioritize safety.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Indeed bitcoin is a good investment, but let us not forget that putting all your apples in one basket is not a good idea. It is better to learn about possible investment options before stepping in to put money here and there. Pros and cons exist in every sector and even though on this forum the bitcoin investment might sound like an echochamber, outside the forum you will not find it to be so.In reality yes, keep crypto limited to only bitcoin, but also explore real estate, precious metals, bonds, stocks relevant as per the country where one lives. If you are going for the long term route for each of them and have a stable enough income, you can grow your money safely over the years with all these combined in a different weightage ratios.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: The chart shows that people are now appreciating bitcoin more than ever, recognizing its positive value for the years ahead. This reinforces the idea that, despite claims it would disappear, people continue to place their faith in bitcoin—a faith that’s fueling a surge in investors. We’re also seeing that bitcoin is far from something to overlook, as it could very well prove to be an even more profitable investment in the future.In fact, smaller countries are adopting bitcoin, helping it gain even greater global exposure and driving up its price. So, I’d say those who ignored bitcoin years ago are probably buying in now!
